soft_x_rays.channel.documentation: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera)

soft_x_rays.channel[:].aperture.documentation: Description of a set of collimating apertures

soft_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].centr.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].geome.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

soft_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].outli.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Do NOT repeat the first point.
Index in the error_description list for "x1"
Index in the error_description list for "x2"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].radiu.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2
Index in the error_description list for "radius"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].surfa.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data
Index in the error_description list for "surface"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].x1_un.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is horizontal and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].x1_wi.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x1_width"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].x2_un.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].x2_wi.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x2_width"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].aperture[:].x3_un.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].brightness.documentation: Power flux received by the detector, per unit solid angle and per unit area (i.e. power divided by the etendue), in multiple energy bands if available from the detector

soft_x_rays.channel[:].brightness.data_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.centre.p.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.centre.r.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "r"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.centre.z.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "z"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.geometry.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Do NOT repeat the first point.

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.outline..documentation: Index in the error_description list for "x1"
Index in the error_description list for "x2"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.radius_e.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "radius"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.surface.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.surface_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "surface"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.x1_unit_.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is horizontal and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.x1_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x1_width"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.x2_unit_.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.x2_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3
Index in the error_description list for "x2_width"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].detector.x3_unit_.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.
Index in the error_description list for "x"
Index in the error_description list for "y"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].energy_band.documentation: Set of energy bands in which photons are counted by the detector

soft_x_rays.channel[:].energy_band[:].de.documentation: Probability of detection of a photon impacting the detector as a function of its energy
Index in the error_description list for "detection_efficiency"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].energy_band[:].en.documentation: Array of discrete energy values inside the band
Index in the error_description list for "energies"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].energy_band[:].lo.documentation: Lower bound of the energy band
Index in the error_description list for "lower_bound"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].energy_band[:].up.documentation: Upper bound of the energy band
Index in the error_description list for "upper_bound"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].etendue.documentation: Etendue (geometric extent) of the channel's optical system

soft_x_rays.channel[:].etendue_error_ind.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "etendue"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].etendue_method.documentation: Method used to calculate the etendue. Index = 0 : exact calculation with a 4D integral; 1 : approximation with first order formula (detector surface times solid angle subtended by the apertures); 2 : other methods

soft_x_rays.channel[:].etendue_method.in.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

soft_x_rays.channel[:].line_of_sight.documentation: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points

soft_x_rays.channel[:].line_of_sight.fir.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].line_of_sight.sec.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Index in the error_description list for "phi"
Index in the error_description list for "r"
Index in the error_description list for "z"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].power.documentation: Power received on the detector, in multiple energy bands if available from the detector

soft_x_rays.channel[:].power.data_error_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "data"

soft_x_rays.channel[:].validity.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the channel for the whole acquisition period (0 means valid, negative values mean non-valid)

soft_x_rays.channel[:].validity_timed.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the channel as a function of time (0 means valid, negative values mean non-valid)

soft_x_rays.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

soft_x_rays.code.library.documentation: List of external libraries used by the code that has produced this IDS

soft_x_rays.code.library[:].parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

soft_x_rays.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

soft_x_rays.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

soft_x_rays.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

soft_x_rays.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

soft_x_rays.ids_properties.creation_date.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

soft_x_rays.ids_properties.homogeneous_t.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

soft_x_rays.ids_properties.occurrence.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

soft_x_rays.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

soft_x_rays.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)

soft_x_rays.ids_properties.version_put.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS

soft_x_rays.ids_properties.version_put.a.documentation: Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS

soft_x_rays.ids_properties.version_put.d.documentation: Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

soft_x_rays.latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between physical information received by the detector and data available on the real-time (RT) network.

soft_x_rays.latency_error_index.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "latency"
